thread.title: North Sea oil output to reach two-year high in November
thread.title_full: North Sea oil output to reach two-year high in November

title: North Sea oil output to reach two-year high in November
text:
(Replaces table to display October output totals) 
LONDON, Oct (HKSE: 3366-OL.HK - news ) 16 (Reuters) - North Sea crude oil output 
tracked by Reuters will rise to its highest monthly level in two 
years in November, according to loading schedules, adding to 
ample Atlantic Basin supplies. 
Supply from 12 crude streams will average 2.086 million 
barrels per day (bpd), up from 2.065 million bpd in October, 
according to Reuters calculations based on loading programmes 
provided by trade sources. 
That is the highest since the 2.149 million bpd planned in 
November 2013, according to Reuters records. 
North Sea oil output is in long-term decline as the 
easier-to-extract reserves are pumped out. Still, investments 
made in recent years, such as the Golden Eagle (HKSE: 3308-OL.HK - news ) project which 
started up in 2014, are helping to expand supplies. 
Output of the four crudes that set the Brent benchmark 
--Brent itself, Forties, Oseberg and Ekofisk -- is still set to 
be higher in November despite planned maintenance on the Buzzard 
oilfield, the largest field contributing to the Forties stream. 
The table below is based on the latest known loading 
programmes for 12 crude streams as tracked by Reuters. 
Volumes are in millions of barrels and loading rates are in 
barrels per day. 
Brent 120,000 3.60 116,000 3.60 
Forties 440,000 13.20 426,000 13.20 
Oseberg 120,000 3.60 116,000 3.60 
Ekofisk 300,000 9.00 290,000 9.00 
DUC (LSE: 0O3S.L - news ) 80,000 2.40 58,000 1.80 
Flotta Gold 90,000 2.70 97,000 3.00 
Gullfaks 189,000 5.66 182,000 5.66 
Statfjord 189,000 5.67 208,000 6.46 
Troll 220,000 6.60 271,000 8.40 
TOTAL (Swiss: FP.SW - news ) 1,748,000 52.43 1,764,000 54.72 
Asgard 114,000 3.42 110,000 3.42 
Alvheim 104,000 3.12 75,000 2.34 
Grane 120,000 3.60 116,000 3.60 
TOTAL 2,086,000 62.57 2,065,000 64.08 
NOTES: Totals are rounded and may not add up exactly. 
DUC, Troll, Brent, Forties, Ekofisk and Oseberg cargoes are 
typically of 600,000 barrels, although sometimes several 
non-standard sizes are included. 
Statfjord cargoes can be 800,000 barrels, while Alvheim 
cargoes are mainly 780,000 barrels. 
Loading programmes are usually issued to equity holders 
between the first and tenth of each month. Reuters attempts to 
track significant revisions based on actual production levels. 
(Editing by Dale Hudson)
